data.title: LeftFourdie
data.solution:
lst=[]
n,m=map(int,(input().split()))
j=1
for i in range(n):
    skill=int(input())
    lst.append(skill)
while True:
    k=0
    for t in range(n):
        k+=int(j/lst[t])
    j+=1  
    if k>=m:
        print(j-1)
        break
data.statement:
You and your friend made the decision to leave to get fresh supplies after the supplies were nearly depleted but there were numerous zombies all throughout the city. When you and your buddies go out, you are confronted with [[m]] zombies, but you and your friends are only [[n]] in number, each of whom has various combat abilities. So you must arrange to spend as little time as possible killing zombies for yourself and your allies.


It's a 1-1 fight between humans and zombies.

<<Example>>

<<input:>>
3 10
1
3
12
<<output:>>
8

write answer

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

You and your friend made the decision to leave to get fresh supplies after the supplies were nearly depleted but there were numerous zombies all throughout the city. When you and your buddies go out, you are confronted with m zombies, but you and your friends are only n in number, each of whom has various combat abilities. So you must arrange to spend as little time as possible killing zombies for yourself and your allies.


It's a 1-1 fight between humans and zombies.

Example

input:
3 10
1
3
12
output:
8
Input
Line 1 : An integer n for the number of humans and integer m for the number of zombies, in order, separated by space.
Next n lines: An integer t for The time it takes each person to kill a zombie.
Output
Line 1 : An integer of the shortest time to kill all zombies.
Constraints
1 <= n,m<=10000
1 <= t<=100000
Example
Input
2 6
7
10
Output
28
